meanings.definition: A type of small, primitive arthropod with elongated bodies and 11 pairs of legs.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, the pauropods scurried along the ground, their many legs moving quickly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study pauropods to learn more about these ancient creatures.
meanings.sent3: The tiny pauropods decided to have a race to see who was the fastest crawler.
meanings.sent4: The classroom was filled with excitement as the students observed the peculiar pauropods in their terrarium.
meanings.sent5: The discovery of a new species of pauropods amazed the scientific community.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'pauropod', referring to multiple individuals of this species.
meanings.sent1: The forest floor was teeming with pauropods, each one moving independently.
meanings.sent2: The researchers collected samples of various pauropods for further analysis.
meanings.sent3: During the picnic, the children were surprised by the playful antics of the pauropods.
meanings.sent4: The garden became a bustling community as the pauropods made their homes among the plants.
meanings.sent5: The zoo exhibit showcased a diverse array of pauropods from different regions.
